page.title: 16Cleobury Wakes
page.content: On Sunday, 12th May, the Pentabus Theatre Company organised an afternoon's entertainment at Lacon Childe School called "Cleobury Wakes". Performers came from Pentabus, local schools and the area extending from Clee Hill to Stottesdon. It began with dancing round a May bough in the playground. Everyone then went in the hall, where the past was revived in scenes showing local customs and characters. There was Morris dancing, Victorian School day, playground games and miming of cock-fighting and a day in the quarries. Children from our Primary School performed maypole dances. All round the hall were craft stalls with corn dollies, herbs, lace making, candle making, home baked biscuits and bread, dairy produce and such things. The Bray Construction Band played music to listen to.
